reviewText: Covering the speech in the moment and seeing the reaction of the crowd was magical. However, it wish there was more to this DVD like behind the scenes work, newscast of the election and other items that happened before the speech was made. That is where the real excitement lies...in the details. I gave this DVD a 3-star because although the speech is recorded, more content could have been added along with the news articles read by its writers.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've never experienced anything as moving and thrilling as Election Night 2008 and sadly this DVD did not come close to capturing that.  As another reviewer said, I was very disappointed that they did not include the network election coverage (and found the handheld video shots of a few random people quite a letdown).  I was let down by this - not worth the money, ultimately.Fortunately, Obama is President, so who cares about a lame dvd??
Title: N/A

reviewText: No other political moment can compare to this one. This DVD brought tears to my eyes as I watched the first African American president walk on stage with his family and make a breathtaking speech! This moment is truly unforgettable!
Title: N/A

reviewText: First of all I am a very true liberal democrat. Watching the returns and for the first couple of states were called for McCain I started to get depressed but within mere minutes other states started calling Obama. After 8 horrible years to see history being made, not only did I yell and scream "Thank God we are back in control" and by the way scaring my dogs with my excitement. I cried as he went on stage with Biden and both of their families, tears of happiness were falling. I supported Hillary in the primary but quickly got on board Obama's immediately and without hesitation, for I am a Democrat and will only vote my party. I still cry when I watch this and look forward in owning a bit of history. When I seen the tears flowing from Reverened Jackson and Oprah among us all I realized the significance and why we were crying. The significance of a black man winning the highest office, Obama unites not divides. His color isn't an issue to me, I'm fortunate I was brought up to respect everyone not just my race. This was an unbelievable night, amazing, historic. He is our President, he has a vision, he cares about others, and he's intelligent and articulate and very awe-inspiring. I'm so happy that the black community is fully represented, from Rosa Parks's historic action on a bus, to slavery. We are one! We are ONE. I'm very proud of Obama, thank you for uniting our country and thank you for your dedication to our country.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When I received my DVD, "This is Our Moment" it was extremely enlightening, to see as well as view again; one of the most memorable moment in addition to history in the very making. I hope to again, purchase other DVD's about one of the most soon to be; well known Presidents of our time.

reviewText: Excellent documentary. In it you will witness the beginning of the decline of America.Study this video and compare it to Reagan's election night. This will shed light on how far America has declined.
summary: Excellent documentary about the beginning of the decline of America
